description: The four-story Church façade and prominent seven-story tower is covered in Portland stone and highlighted by a golden steeple. The interior features the Christus statue and a large mural of the resurrected Jesus Christ.

factsheet.heading: Location
paragraphs: Strategically located on Exhibition Road, the Hyde Park Chapel is regarded as one of the most well-known world-wide meetinghouses of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.  This religious structure is adjacent to the Victoria and Albert Museum, across the street from Natural History and Science Museums, and across from Imperial College London.  Before COVID-19, Exhibition Road was the scene of over 10 million visitors a year.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: The Chapel was built in 1960 on a vacate site where elegant townhouses were bombed on July 3, 1944 during WW2.  A memorial plaque was placed in the Chapel in remembrance of one family that lost their lives on the site due to enemy action.  When the Church purchased the land for the Hyde Park building there was not a single member residing within a seven-mile radius.

factsheet.heading: Building
paragraphs: After the bombed-out site was purchased in 1959, prominent London architect Sir Thomas P. Bennett, CBE, was engaged to design the building.  The façade is covered by Portland Stone, a popular material for buildings across the United Kingdom dating back to the Roman era.  Construction began in 1960 and the new structure was dedicated on February 26, 1961, by then President David O. McKay.

factsheet.heading: Hyde Park Chapel
paragraphs: The interior features the Christus statue (replica of Bertel Thorvaldsen’s resurrected Jesus Christ in Church of Our Lady Lutheran Cathedral, Copenhagen, Denmark), stained glass by Pierre Fourmaintraux from Whitefriars Glass company, and a 2,718 pipe organ designed by William Hill & Son and Norman & Beard Ltd.  This modern Chapel and place of worship is also a multi-use facility serving as Visitor Centre, Family History Centre, Cultural Hall for sports and local NHS Blood Drives, and offices for Self-Reliance, Facilities Management, Public Affairs, and clergy.   The Chapel is also the headquarters for the England London Mission with 160 full-time missionaries ages 19-24 in the London area from over 25 different countries.  The Chapel houses three congregations—two family oriented and one young single adult. This complex is also the centre for the London England Hyde Park Stake (similar to a diocese), comprising seven wards or congregations and over 2,000 members from over 50 countries.

factsheet.heading: Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
paragraphs: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints was formally organized in a small log cabin in upstate New York (USA) in 1830.  Today the Church has 16.5 million members in over 160 countries with members speaking nearly 180 languages.  Nearly 200,000 members reside in United Kingdom.  Two of the Church’s 167 worldwide operating temples are in England--Newchapel, Surrey and Chorley, Lancashire.
